document.docAuthor: Liu, Zhen, He, Jun-Hua & Chen, Xue-Xin
document.masterDocTitle: The laevigata - group of the genus Dolichogenidea Mason, 1981 from China, with descriptions of 26 new species

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: The laevigata - group of the genus Dolichogenidea Mason, 1981 from China, with descriptions of 26 new species

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Apanteles sicarius
Marshall, 1885 : 209
. Holotype in BMNH.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Apanteles chrysostictus Marshall, 1889
(4): 466. Syn. by Wilkinson (1945) .

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Apanteles crudelis Papp, 1971
:
Papp, 1976 : 235
. Syn. by Papp (1978) .

subSubSection.paragraph: Diagnosis. Pterostigma evenly brown throughout; wings usually milky-white; metacarp about twice as long as its distance from apex of the marginal cell; 1 st discal cell slightly wider than high; antenna not longer than mesosoma plus metasoma, with 15–17 segments distinctly longer than wide; ovipositor sheath usually as long as hind tibia; legs very dark, hind femur always blackish throughout; spines on outer side of hind tibia rather weak and not numerous; T1 distinctly a little widened towards apex; and horizontal surface of T1 about twice as wide as long, dull, with satiny sheen overlying traces of punctuation.

Host.
Phalonia epilinana Linne
( Lepidoptera : Tortricidae ) ( new record ); Plutellidae , Tortricidae , Oecophoridae , Choreutidae , Crambidae , Elachistidae , Gelechiidae , Pyralidae , Momphidae .
Viaration. Some specimens with yellowish-brown metasoma.
Male. Wings more conspicuously milky-white than in female.

Distribution. China ( Hebei ,
Inner Mongolia
, Liaoning , Shannxi, Sichuan , Tibet , Xinjiang , Zhejiang ) new record ; Eastern Palaearctic, Europe, Oceanic, Western Palaearctic.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 27.
Dolichogenidea sandwico
Liu
& Chen
,
sp. n. a
head, dorsal view; b propodeum and metasoma, dorsal view; c head, frontal view; d habitus, lateral view; e mesonotum and scutellum; f hind wing; g fore wing. Scale line = 0.5 mm.

subSubSection.paragraph: Note. Features of the specimens agree with the descriptions of Wilkinson (1945) , Telenga (1955) , Nixon
